clinical_study.official_title: Current Status of Antihypertensive Drug Treatment in Non-cardiac Surgical Population

brief_summary.textblock: A cohort of hypertension patients undergoing elective non-cardiac surgery was constructed to investigate current status of antihypertensive drug treatment in non-cardiac surgical population.

detailed_description.textblock: Perioperative changes in blood pressure (BP) are associated with perioperative risks. However, there is little information regarding the current status of antihypertensive treatment in non-cardiac surgical population. A cohort of 351 hypertension patients aged between 18 to 85-year old undergoing elective non-cardiac surgery was constructed to investigate the application of antihypertensive drugs, systemic involvement, perioperative hemodynamics and internal environment to grasp the perioperative impact of different antihypertensive drugs, and to further provide a reference for the preoperative antihypertensive strategy of surgery patients.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from the moment on arrival to the operating room until the moment leaving PACU, assessed up to 240 minutes.
primary_outcome.description: baseline BP before the operation, when entering and exiting post-anesthesia care unit(PACU)

secondary_outcome.measure: pH, base excess, and concentration of HCO3- in blood gases
secondary_outcome.description: arterial blood gases detected by using the ABL800 (Radiometer Med Aps Ltd, Copenhagen, Denmark)

secondary_outcome.measure: the incidence of hypotension in PACU
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the moment on arrival to PACU until 60 minutes after arriving or the moment leaving PACU, whichever came first, assessed up to 240 minutes.
secondary_outcome.description: If there were more than two consecutive episodes of hypotension (which was defined as SBP less than 80% of baseline) a "rescue" intravenous bolus of 100 mg of phenylephrine was given.

secondary_outcome.measure: the incidence of hypertension in PACU
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the moment on arrival to PACU until 60 minutes after arriving or the moment leaving PACU, whichever came first, assessed up to 240 minutes.
secondary_outcome.description: the incidence of hypertension, which was defined as SBP greater than 120% of baseline

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the date of admission until the date of discharge or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed up to 100 days
secondary_outcome.description: The duration of this single episode of hospitalization

arm_group.description: Group of angiotensin receptor blockers(ARB) monotherapy users. A subject was considered as an ARB user when the total prescription days of ARB monotherapy was at least 30.

Group of calcium channel blockers(CCB) and angiotensin receptor blockers(ARB) combination users. A subject was considered as a CCB and ARB combination user when the total prescription days of CCB and ARB combination therapy was at least 30.
Group of calcium channel blockers(CCB) monotherapy users. A subject was considered as a CCB user when the total prescription days of CCB monotherapy was at least 30.
Group of nonusers of antihypertensives. A subject was considered as a nonuser never received regular antihypertensive treatment or total prescription days of antihypertensives was less than 30.

study_pop.textblock: patients undergoing elective non-cardiac surgery in Renji hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients undergoing elective non-cardiac surgery with hypertension(i.e., with a systolic blood pressure(SBP) of >=140 mmHg and/or a diastolic blood pressure(DBP) of >=90 mmHg based on the Seventh Report of the Joint National Committee on Prevention, Detection, Evaluation, and Treatment of High Blood Pressure) or self-reported use of antihypertensive medication
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients under the age of 18 years old
- Patients more than 85 years old
- Patients suspected of intracranial hypertension
